v.v: Then Job answered and said,
“Listen carefully to my words,
Put up with me, and I also will speak;
As for me, is my complaint to a person?
Look at me and be astonished,
When I think about my sufferings, I am terrified,
Why do wicked people continue to live,
Their descendants are established with them in their sight,
Their houses are safe from fear;
Their bull breeds; it does not fail to do so;
They send out their little ones like a flock,
They sing to the tambourine and harp
They spend their days in prosperity,
They say to God, ‘Depart from us
What is the Almighty, that we should worship him?
See, is not their prosperity in their own hands?
How often is it that the lamp of wicked people is put out,
How often is it that they become like stubble before the wind
You say, ‘God lays up one’s guilt for his children to pay.’
Let his eyes see his own destruction,
For what does he care about his family after him
Can anyone teach God knowledge
One man dies in his full strength,
His body is full of milk,
Another man dies in bitterness of soul,
They lie down alike in the dust;
See, I know your thoughts,
For you say, ‘Where now is the house of the prince?
Have you never asked traveling people?
that the wicked man is kept from the day of calamity,
Who will condemn the wicked man’s way to his face?
Yet he will be borne to the grave;
The clods of the valley will be sweet to him;
How then do you comfort me with nonsense,

v: and let this be the comfort you offer to me.
after I have spoken, mock on.
Why should I not be impatient?
and lay your hand upon your mouth.
and trembling seizes my body.
become old, and grow mighty in power?
and their offspring are established before their eyes.
neither is the rod of God on them.
their cow gives birth and does not lose her calf prematurely.
and their children dance.
and rejoice with the music of the flute.
and they go down quietly to Sheol.
for we do not wish any knowledge of your ways.
What advantage would we get if we prayed to him?’
I have nothing to do with the advice of wicked people.
or that their calamity comes upon them?
How often does it happen that God distributes sorrows to them in his anger?
or like chaff that the storm carries away?
Let him pay it himself, so that he might know his guilt.
and let him drink of the wrath of the Almighty.
when the number of his months is cut off?
since he judges even those who are high?
being completely quiet and at ease.
and the marrow of his bones is moist.
one who has never experienced anything good.
the worms cover them both.
and the ways in which you wish to wrong me.
Where is the tent in which the wicked man once lived?’
Do you not know the evidence they can tell,
and that he is led away from the day of wrath?
Who will repay him for what he has done?
men will keep watch over his tomb.
all people will follow after him,
as there were innumerable people before him.
since in your answers there is nothing but falsehood?”
